item.title: A generalization of the Parameterized Expectations Algorithm
A Generalization of the Parameterized Expectation Algorithm
item.description: Introduction This blog post is about my work on a generalization of the Parameterized Expectations Algorithm, available here. The Parameterized Expectations Algorithm (PEA) is a classic computational approach to numerically “solve” economic models with rational expectations, i.e. finding an approximate solution. item.title: The bias-corrected Monte Carlo operator
item.description: Introduction In this blog post, I am going to present my recent work on the bias-corrected Monte Carlo operator, or more compactly “bc-MC operator”, which was recently published here in the JEDC. In this paper, I propose a new methodology to combine Monte Carlo and neural networks to solve large scale economic models.
